title: Joy And Sorrow
opening: Marth was unable to reunite with Princess Minerva, and so, in order to help Ogma and the Grustian royal children, he decided to visit Wendell, who was once the children's guardian.
However, the "Holm Beach" where Wendell resides is dominion of the infamous Macedonian Vikings. Countless pirates await in Marth's path. Will Marth be able to safely rescue the children...?

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: Kris, may I have a moment? Wh-what in the blazes!? M-may I ask, what happened to your hair?

intro.speaker: Kris
intro.line: Father Wrys cut my hair for me. Is something wrong, sire?

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: He, uh, certainly did. Well, if you like it, then wonderful. ...... W-well then, let's begin the war council.

intro.speaker: Ogma
intro.line: Yuliya, Jubelo. This place is notorious for the Macedonian Vikings. If we could, we'd stay the hell away, but the village where Lord Wendell resides is just past this area.

intro.speaker: Jubelo
intro.line: Mister Ogma... I'm scared... Can we go back...?

intro.speaker: Yuliya
intro.line: Jubelo! Get a hold of yourself! You're a man, are you not? Show some spine! You can use a Fire tome, can't you? So... fight with it!

intro.speaker: Jubelo
intro.line: But Master Wendell said that we mustn't fight... Besides, I don't like fighting.

intro.speaker: Yuliya
intro.line: Ugh, stop complaining! It's just you and me now. You have to stay strong, because I... sniff... I don't know what we're supposed to do...

intro.speaker: Jubelo
intro.line: Oh... I'm sorry, Yuliya... I'll do my best, so... please don't cry!

intro.speaker: Ogma
intro.line: Damn... This can't be good... We've been spotted. Kids, we've got no choice; we're going to have to cut through. Do not leave my side!

visit.speaker: Boy
visit.line: D'you know of a staff called Rescue? I hear you can bring faraway allies right next to you in a flash! It'd be so cool if it were true!

visit.speaker: Girl
visit.line: Oh, those "Star Shards" are so shiny and pretty. If you hold on to them, something good might happen to you.

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: These days, all them bandits and pirates've been doin' as they please. Geez. This wouldn't 'ave 'appened if it weren't for all them political tomfoolery.

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: Oh, you're... you're... the prince of Altea! How nice of you to drop by, sir!

visit.speaker: Marth
visit.line: I heard Lord Wendell was living here.

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: Yes, that, er... was correct... Yesterday, a group of Archanean soldiers suddenly came and took the pontifex away. Although, Prince... He did leave his magic tome behind. I believe it's wind magic. Please, take it with you.

recruit-visit.speaker: Marth
recruit-visit.line: Well, if it isn't Castor! What brings you to a place like this?

recruit-visit.speaker: Castor
recruit-visit.line: Ah, Prince Marth! Erm... Actually, I need money for medicine for me sick mother. But I couldn't find any work in Talys, so I moved here instead.

recruit-visit.speaker: Marth
recruit-visit.line: I see... That's terrible... I do hope your mother gets better. Well, goodbye then...

recruit-visit.speaker: Castor
recruit-visit.line: ......... Wait!! Me mother, she's really sick... I need money, sir...

recruit-visit.speaker: Marth
recruit-visit.line: Hm? Oh right, here. It's only a little, but I hope it helps.

recruit-visit.speaker: Castor
recruit-visit.line: Uhm... Thank you, Prince Marth. You don't have to be so kind to a guy like me...

recruit-visit.speaker: Marth
recruit-visit.line: Castor... That's a bit much... It's only natural to help someone in need.

recruit-visit.speaker: Castor
recruit-visit.line: No, Prince Marth! You've done so much for me. I want to help you. Please, let me fight alongside you. You have my life at your disposal!!

battle.speaker: Guile
battle.line: Gahahaha! Won't be long now 'til my boys, hidden in the forts, all spring out 'n' attack. I can almost see the precious looks on their bewildered faces!

recruit-talk.speaker: Ogma
recruit-talk.line: And just who the hell are you? Are you in league with the pirates?

recruit-talk.speaker: Sirius
recruit-talk.line: I am Sirius, a mere traveler.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ogma
recruit-talk.line: Oh, I see. I'm a little bit worked up right now. Sorry about the mix-up.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ogma
recruit-talk.line: I'm taking care of them. Do you know them?

recruit-talk.speaker: Sirius
recruit-talk.line: No, I don't... But I do know that, as things stand, you won't escape with them. As I understand it, the Altean army should arrive here, provided you reach the southern village. Please, allow me to distract the bandits, while you make your escape to safety.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ogma
recruit-talk.line: I see. So Prince Marth is here, eh? Got it, thanks. I've got to ask though. Why help a group of complete strangers like us?

recruit-talk.speaker: Sirius
recruit-talk.line: I want to save the children. That is... all.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ogma
recruit-talk.line: I see... Sirius... You said your name was Sirius, right? Let's meet again after we both get out of here! There's someone I need to take care of... The guy in charge of Grust's occupation, Commander Lang. I want to avenge a man named Lorenz... You--join me...! If I've got you on my side, then I'll be that much stronger.

recruit-talk.speaker: Sirius
recruit-talk.line: Yes... That would be interesting. But first, you have to survive. Hurry and go!

recruit-battle.speaker: Sirius
recruit-battle.line: Touch me and I'll strike you down.

boss.speaker: Guile
boss.line: I'm sorry! ...I wasn't thinking! Gahaha, just kidding! I'll be smashing your pretty head in!!

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Caeda? Did something happen? Why are you here?

end.speaker: Caeda
end.line: Marth... Altea... Altea was attacked by the imperial army. The Archanean League... Gra and Aurelis ambushed us. Our forces were annihilated and we lost the castle...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Wh-what did you say?! This can't be happening! Altea is...

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Damn! Our homeland has fallen to the enemy...

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: This is terrible beyond words... That which I feared the most has come to pass. Emperor Hardin likely heard Lang's story, and had us branded traitors.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: I refuse to believe it. Hardin would never attack Altea! You're telling me that he believed Lang and truly thought that I wished to instigate a rebellion? Never!

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: No, I agree with you, sire. This attack was too soon. It happened far too quickly. For an attack of this scale, a great number of preparations had to have been in place. It is likely... that the Grust campaign was a setup. As was the situation in Macedon. It's quite simple, really. They had you leave Altea, with your elite knights in tow, and then proceeded to attack our weakened defenses. Hardin had this planned right from the start.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: That's preposterous! Are you implying that Hardin--with no provocation whatsoever--decided to attack his fellow nation? Are you seriously suggesting this was all an elaborate trap? No! I won't accept it... Hardin... why?

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Sire... Princess Caeda, what of the others? Is Princess Elice safe?

end.speaker: Caeda
end.line: Elice, she... She gave herself up in order to let me escape with this message. Marth... I'm so sorry. She wanted me to warn you, no matter what... Sniff...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Caeda... Don't cry. I understand. Just knowing you're safe makes me happy. I should be the one apologizing. I shouldn't have left... You needn't have to go through this. We will take back Altea. Even if we have to fight Hardin, we WILL reclaim our homeland!

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Oh, by the way, Kris. About that hairstyle of yours... Have you decided to keep it that way?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: ...Do you think it looks funny? Well, it'll grow back eventually, if I leave it alone... Do you think I should return it to normal?

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Well, it's your decision to make. You should do as you please. So what will it be? Are you going to go back to the hairstyle you had before?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Yeah. I'll have to apologize to Father Wrys later, but I think I'll change it back to normal.

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Yes. I do believe that would be a good idea.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: No, it's alright. I'm quite fond of my new hair... Or lack of it, rather.

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: I-is that so? Well, if that's your wish, then I can hardly complain.
